Description:
In a wet and dark chamber, there is a stone statue of the Great Bird holding a bowl with some blood, from which dark energies emanate, spreading throughout the room. It would be just another statue of the Great Bird, but this time it seems to serve a darker purpose.

Hundreds of eggs of different sizes and species are scattered around the room, and they seem to be absorbing the dark energy.

There is no doubt: the Great Bird’s acolytes are corrupting these eggs for some dark purpose.
DescriptionAction: Are you going to do anything about it?

    "SSRewardHealthPercent": 0.0,
    "SSRewardText": "Whatever they are doing here, it is up to no good, so you decide to destroy the eggs before they become a problem.\n\nIt may be an extreme solution, but who knows what damage the creatures born from these eggs may cause.\n\nEven if some of you feel bad for this merciless act, you try to find solace in the idea that it has been for the greater good.",

    "SSRewardText": "Thuls is determined to help all the eggs by any means, and he climbs the statue and empties the contents of one of his little pouches into the bowl.\r\n\nHe explains to you that he just used a magical powder he saves for emergencies when he needs to nullify the effects of his target’s magic. It is an important asset in his line of work.\r\n\nHe also tells you that the effects won’t last long, but hopefully it will be enough to make the Great Bird pay for all the damage it is causing to the cold-blooded races. Thuls urges you to hurry and find the Great Bird as soon as possible!",

    "FLRewardText": "Thuls is determined to help all the eggs by any means, and he climbs the statue and empties the contents of one of his little pouches into the bowl.\r\n\nHe explains to you that he just used a magical powder he saves for emergencies when he needs to nullify the effects of his target’s magic, but the magic of the bowl is more powerful than his powder, and the eggs are beyond salvation now.\r\n\nNonetheless, Thuls asks you not to destroy these eggs, as he believes that the tainted breed that will hatch from them deserves a chance to live too. Disappointed at not being able to save the eggs from corruption, but determined to make the Great Bird pay for all the harm it has caused his people, Thuls urges you to continue.",
